Body: Things are'nt particularly good here also...significant layoffs soon...a sad day for all of us. Hang in there.   -----Original Message----- From:  Assad, Sergio   Sent: Tuesday, November 27, 2001 4:11 PM To: Shapiro, Richard Subject: Regulatory Affairs Sao Paulo  Rick  Unfortunately, as  consequence of Enron problems,  today we just start a headcount reduction in Sao Paulo office.  Our  regulatory  team will be composed by myself, Fred Sampaio and Luiz Baccaro, dealing with Enron Merchant interests and Elektro also.  Jos? Lucio will  work us  until completion Cuiaba (aprox more 1 or 2 month).  I know you are facing same difficult in Houston, so hope everything is OK with your team and you also!    Thanks
Subject: RE: Regulatory Affairs Sao Paulo

Body: I am not sure, that in any of the calls that we have had during the crisis = surrounding Enron, that I have been able to fully express the depth of my g= ratitude to each of you.  I am as grateful as one can be.  Like many of you= , I loved this place and feel an immense sense of loss at what is occurring= .  My heart also aches for the financial losses that so many have suffered,=  not only in our group, but also throughout the company, particularly given=  how much all of us have given to this place, some for many years.  I have = been searching for a way to capture what we've done here and was reading a = book the other day about Teddy Roosevelt, former President of the United St= ates, and saw a quote that I thought was appropriate to our group and circu= mstances?the quote is,=20  "the credit belongs to the person who is actually in the arena?who strives = valiantly, who knows the great enthusiasms, the great devotions and spends = himself in worthy causes.  Who, at best, knows the triumph of high achievem= ent and who, at worst, if he fails, fails while daring greatly so that his = place shall never be with those cold and timid souls, who knew neither vict= ory nor defeat."  The work that we did here was great.  The way we did it, I believe, sets an=  example for those who will attempt to fill our shoes?and we fought for the=  right cause, i.e., competitive markets around the world.  Our victories we= re many and often directly due to our presence and leadership?the failure t= hat we are experiencing as a company, however, that is so deep and so thoro= ugh, was not of our making.  I don't know exactly what the days and weeks a= head hold for any of us, but I am quite confident that the good work that w= e do and the way that we do it, and the sense of community that we were abl= e to create in this group, will show up in new places and new companies all=  around the world over the next months and years.  I hope to speak to many,=  if not all of you, on a one to one basis over the next several weeks to ex= press my thanks and gratitude for having had the opportunity to work with y= ou, but I also want to take this opportunity to wish each of you the best i= n the future and during this holiday season.  Thank you

Body: Richard:  Sorry to see the demise of Enron and it's obvious impact on you.  I'll try to pass along your resume where I think it may be of interest.  Good luck.  Hope to cross paths with you sometime.  Keep me posted on what you end up doing.  Best regards,  Wayne Shirley Director The Regulatory Assistance Project 177 Water St. Gardiner, ME 04345 Toll Free: 1-800-219-6347 Tel:  207-582-1135 Fax: 207-582-1176 Website:  <http://www.rapmaine.org/>
Subject: Re: The Future

Body: thanks.  -----Original Message----- From: Shapiro, Richard  Sent: Thursday, December 06, 2001 5:20 PM To: Dasovich, Jeff; Dernehl, Ginger Subject: Re: Tuition   Yes -------------------------- Rick S.   -----Original Message----- From: Dasovich, Jeff <Jeff.Dasovich@ENRON.com> To: Dernehl, Ginger <Ginger.Dernehl@ENRON.com>; Shapiro, Richard <Richard.Shapiro@ENRON.com> Sent: Thu Dec 06 17:05:19 2001 Subject: Tuition  As soon as I get my grades (which I hope will be mid-late December), I'll send them to Ginger in the attempt to get tuition reimbursed.  But don't worry, I have extremely low expectations about the likelihood of getting reimbursed.  This plan make sense?  Best, Jeff
Subject: RE: Tuition

Body: How about next Monday or Tuesday?     -----Original Message----- From: Amr Ibrahim [mailto:aibrahim1@houston.rr.com] Sent: Monday, December 10, 2001 9:39 AM To: Shapiro, Richard; Steffes, James D. Subject: Fw: Miss you guys   2nd time.     ----- Original Message -----  From: Amr Ibrahim <mailto:aibrahim1@houston.rr.com>  To: rick.shapiro@enron.com <mailto:rick.shapiro@enron.com> ; jim.steffess@enron.com <mailto:jim.steffess@enron.com>  Cc: rickshapiro@hotmail.com <mailto:rickshapiro@hotmail.com>  Sent: Monday, December 10, 2001 9:22 AM Subject: Miss you guys  Rick, Jim:   I miss you already.  Any plans for lunch this week I wonder?   Brgrds   AI

Body: Monday is better -------------------------- Jim Steffes Enron
Subject: RE: Miss you guys

Body: Steve: You're a very good man and did great work for us...Thank you.  All of us wish you the very best of luck. Warm regards....Rick  -----Original Message-----  From: Walton, Steve  Sent: Thu 12/20/2001 10:01 AM  To: Steffes, James D.; Shapiro, Richard  Cc:  Subject: Resignation from Enron    Jim and Rick,           I will am resigning from Enron and terminating my employment, effective December 31, 2001.  At the first of the year, I will be joining the consulting team building RTO West.            It has been a great opportunity to work with you here at Enron.  I have learned a great deal.  Thanks for all you kindnesses to me.  Steve   Contact Information:   Steven L. Walton  17231 S. Bristle Pine Dr.  Spring, TX 77379  Phone    281-251-5301  Cell    713-594-3142
Subject: RE: Resignation from Enron

Body: Rick,  The information below was provided to us by the FBI's Awareness of National Security Issues and Response (ANSIR) program.  The U.S. Postal Service (USPS) has advised that certain types of incoming U.S. Government mail in the zip code range 202XX-205XX will continue to be irradiated in Lima, Ohio for the foreseeable future.  Mail being irradiated includes letters, flats, packages, express mail and priority mail with stamps for postage.  Mail from known mailers is not being irradiated, which includes USPS Express mail with meter strips and corporate accounts, USPS Priority mail with meter strips or permit indicia, all registered mail, and bulk quantity mail such as catalogs and magazines.  In addition, mail sent through private shipping companies, such as FedEx, UPS, DHL and Airborne, is not being irradiated.  Significant backlogs are occurring at the USPS as a result of the irradiation process.  These backlogs will continue until an additional irradiation facility is tested and opened in Bridgeport, Connecticut.  The USPS recommends that a range of items not be irradiated, including:  magnetic media (credit card, floppy disk, CD-ROM, etc.); plastics sensitive to heat and radiation warping; consumer electronics; photographic film; and photosensitive film and paper.  For these reasons, the FBI recommends using one of the methods mentioned above that will not subject mail to irradiation for corporate communication with U.S. Government offices in these zip codes.
Subject: U.S. Mail Irradiation Update

Body: This is an automatically generated Delivery Status Notification.  Your message has been successfully relayed to the following recipients, but the requested delivery status notifications may not be generated by the destination.         asands@lexgen.com        a.sands@lexgen.com        arthursands@lexgen.com        arthur.sands@lexgen.com     --------- Inline attachment follows ---------  From:  </O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RSHAPIRO> To: asands@lexgen.com Date: Thursday, December 27, 2001 3:06:03 GMT Subject:   Arthur: We don't really know each other, but we have been at functions together since our children, Ellen and Ben, are in second grade together at Cooper. While I'm still at Enron( one of the few), I am diligently developing future opportunities for myself in the wake of the unfortunate events at Enron. Since I can't help but read great things about your company, I thought I would send you a short note to determine if Lexicon might have any interest in someone with a strong government/regulatory affairs background. While I'm assessing a few offers at the moment, they are out of Texas and would require relocation. My desire is to stay here. While I have'nt been doing my line of work in your industry, I'm a quick study; I'm good at what I do; my style at Enron was very different from the reputation of the company( low key, but effective); and the idea of learning a new industry and applying my skills in a new setting is quite appealing. I know Lexicon has constant interaction with varrious facets of government, but I don't fully know how you currently staff those needs and whether someone with my background could be of use...Thus my note. Below are various ways to contact me if there is any interest. Thanks for taking the time to consider this note and Happy Holidays...Rick Shapiro        Richard S. Shapiro     936-321-7153 (hm)    713-853-3407 (wk)    281-831-3749 (cell)    rickshapiro@hotmail.com <mailto:rickshapiro@hotmail.com> richard.shapiro@enron.com        <<Shapiro resume.doc>>
Subject: Delivery Status Notification (Relay)

Body: Get your new AWS WeatherBug today - http://www.weatherbug.com  Hi,  Recently, you visited WeatherBug.com and entered your email address to begin downloading the FREE WeatherBug program onto your PC desktop. Stephanie Blozy WeatherBug Product Manager http://www.weatherbug.com   ***********************   To Unsubscribe: *********************** You are receiving this message because you entered your email address to begin the WeatherBug desktop download. Body: Dan: Relative to support of California issues for "EES/OLDCO", once Jim and his group begin supporting  NETCO, there will be staff remaining (clearly, staffing will be tight, and it's still my hope that Jim decides to stay with "OLDCO/NEWCO) in regulatory affairs (5 professionals including myself) to support you and others on California as well as all other issues for "EES/OLDCO as well as NEWCO....Thanks...Rick    -----Original Message----- From:  Leff, Dan   Sent: Wednesday, January 09, 2002 10:36 AM To: Steffes, James D.; Blachman, Jeremy; Dietrich, Janet; Dasovich, Jeff; Shapiro, Richard; Delainey, David W.; Sharp, Vicki; Smith, Mike D. Subject: CPUC - CA  Jim -   Following up on our discussion.......  Thank you for taking the lead to prep and set up a meeting(s) to get the appropriate team(s) prepared to testify on January 24, 2002.  I realize that there will be many different activities underway in the next couple of weeks, and we all include maintaining / maximizing the value of the CA book and the CPUC activities as critically important.   Thanks - Dan
To: dan.leff@enron.com, d..steffes@enron.com, jeremy.blachman@enron.com,   janet.dietrich@enron.com, jeff.dasovich@enron.com,   w..delainey@enron.com, vicki.sharp@enron.com, d..smith@enron.com
Subject: RE: CPUC - CA
